numericalExperiment.rationale: C4MIP style experiment to diagnose the strength of "slower" carbon cycle responses (ie. feedbacks): Diagnose carbon cycle only response to the CO2 increase.
numericalExperiment.description: Impose conditions identical to 3.1::Control but carbon cycle sees CO2 concentration increase.

numericalRequirement.name: 5.4.ic
numericalRequirement.description: A description of initial condition for the control run

numericalRequirement.name: 5.4.bc.wmg.conc
numericalRequirement.description: Prescribed atmospheric concentrations of pre-industrial well mixed gases: excluding CO2

numericalRequirement.name: 5.4.bc.sls.conc
numericalRequirement.description: Prescribed atmospheric concentration of pre-industrial short lived (reactive) gas species

numericalRequirement.name: 5.4.bc.nat_aer.conc
numericalRequirement.description: Prescribed concentrations of pre-industrial natural aerosols

numericalRequirement.name: 5.4.bc.nat_aer_precur.conc
numericalRequirement.description: Prescribed concentrations of pre-industrial natural aerosol precursors

numericalRequirement.name: 5.4.bc.sl_aer.conc
numericalRequirement.description: Prescribed concentrations of pre-industrial short lived (reactive) aerosol species

numericalRequirement.name: 5.4.bc.nat_aer.em
numericalRequirement.description: Prescribed emissions of pre-industrial natural aerosols

numericalRequirement.name: 5.4.bc.nat_aer_precur.em
numericalRequirement.description: Prescribed emissions of pre-industrial natural aerosol precursors

numericalRequirement.name: 5.4.bc.sl_aer.em
numericalRequirement.description: Prescribed emissions of pre-industrial short lived (reactive) aerosol species

numericalRequirement.name: 5.4.bc.CO2
numericalRequirement.description: Forced with prescribed CO2 concentrations following either (1) spin off from the control (expt. 3.1) at the same point as expt. 6.1 and impose conditions identical to the control except that the carbon cycle "sees" atmospheric CO2 concentration increase at a rate of 1%/yr (as in expt. 6.1)or ( 2) spin off from the control (expt. 3.1) at the same point as expt. 3.2 and impose conditions identical to the control except that the carbon cycle "sees" increasing atmospheric CO2 concentrations that are identical to those prescribed in expt. 3.2 (for the historical period) and expt. 4.1 (RCP4.5 for the future). For both only the carbon cycle only responds to the CO2 increase
